ticket.title: config.i18n.fallbacks away from default locale seems to break unit tests
ticket.original-body:
Adding a locale fallback seems to break unit tests which check validation failures.
Part of app is localised, but the rest, including all the standard validation messages should fall back to english.
With the following code in application.rb config.i18n.default_locale = :lv config.i18n.fallbacks = {:lv => :en}
All the test lines with "assert something.invalid?" fail with error 'I18n::InvalidLocale: nil is not a valid locale'. Trace(below) doesn't show anything useful. Removing fallbacks by commenting the fallback line fixes the issue.
Command failed with status (1): [c:/Ruby/bin/ruby.exe -I"lib;test" "c:/Ruby...] c:/Ruby/lib/ruby/gems/1.8/gems/rake-0.8.7/lib/rake.rb:995 c:/Ruby/lib/ruby/gems/1.8/gems/rake-0.8.7/lib/rake.rb:1010:in `call' c:/Ruby/lib/ruby/gems/1.8/gems/rake-0.8.7/lib/rake.rb:1010:in `sh' c:/Ruby/lib/ruby/gems/1.8/gems/rake-0.8.7/lib/rake.rb:1094:in `sh' c:/Ruby/lib/ruby/gems/1.8/gems/rake-0.8.7/lib/rake.rb:1029:in `ruby' c:/Ruby/lib/ruby/gems/1.8/gems/rake-0.8.7/lib/rake.rb:1094:in `ruby' c:/Ruby/lib/ruby/gems/1.8/gems/railties-3.0.0/lib/rails/test_unit/testing.rake:26 c:/Ruby/lib/ruby/gems/1.8/gems/rake-0.8.7/lib/rake.rb:1112:in `verbose' c:/Ruby/lib/ruby/gems/1.8/gems/railties-3.0.0/lib/rails/test_unit/testing.rake:11 c:/Ruby/lib/ruby/gems/1.8/gems/rake-0.8.7/lib/rake.rb:636:in `call' c:/Ruby/lib/ruby/gems/1.8/gems/rake-0.8.7/lib/rake.rb:636:in `execute' c:/Ruby/lib/ruby/gems/1.8/gems/rake-0.8.7/lib/rake.rb:631:in `each' c:/Ruby/lib/ruby/gems/1.8/gems/rake-0.8.7/lib/rake.rb:631:in `execute' c:/Ruby/lib/ruby/gems/1.8/gems/rake-0.8.7/lib/rake.rb:597:in `invoke_with_call_chain' c:/Ruby/lib/ruby/1.8/monitor.rb:242:in `synchronize' c:/Ruby/lib/ruby/gems/1.8/gems/rake-0.8.7/lib/rake.rb:590:in `invoke_with_call_chain' c:/Ruby/lib/ruby/gems/1.8/gems/rake-0.8.7/lib/rake.rb:583:in `invoke' c:/Ruby/lib/ruby/gems/1.8/gems/rake-0.8.7/lib/rake.rb:2051:in `invoke_task' c:/Ruby/lib/ruby/gems/1.8/gems/rake-0.8.7/lib/rake.rb:2029:in `top_level' c:/Ruby/lib/ruby/gems/1.8/gems/rake-0.8.7/lib/rake.rb:2029:in `each' c:/Ruby/lib/ruby/gems/1.8/gems/rake-0.8.7/lib/rake.rb:2029:in `top_level' c:/Ruby/lib/ruby/gems/1.8/gems/rake-0.8.7/lib/rake.rb:2068:in `standard_exception_handling' c:/Ruby/lib/ruby/gems/1.8/gems/rake-0.8.7/lib/rake.rb:2023:in `top_level' c:/Ruby/lib/ruby/gems/1.8/gems/rake-0.8.7/lib/rake.rb:2001:in `run' c:/Ruby/lib/ruby/gems/1.8/gems/rake-0.8.7/lib/rake.rb:2068:in `standard_exception_handling' c:/Ruby/lib/ruby/gems/1.8/gems/rake-0.8.7/lib/rake.rb:1998:in `run' c:/Ruby/lib/ruby/gems/1.8/gems/rake-0.8.7/bin/rake:31 c:/Ruby/bin/rake:19:in `load' c:/Ruby/bin/rake:19

ticket.original-body-html:
Adding a locale fallback seems to break unit tests which check validation failures.

Part of app is localised, but the rest, including all the standard validation messages should fall back to english.

With the following code in application.rb
config.i18n.default_locale = :lv
config.i18n.fallbacks = {:lv => :en}

All the test lines with "assert something.invalid?" fail with error 'I18n::InvalidLocale: nil is not a valid locale'.
Trace(below) doesn't show anything useful.
Removing fallbacks by commenting the fallback line fixes the issue.

Command failed with status (1): [c:/Ruby/bin/ruby.exe -I"lib;test" "c:/Ruby...]

Adding a locale fallback seems to break unit tests which check validation failures.
Part of app is localised, but the rest, including all the standard validation messages should fall back to english.
With the following code in application.rb config.i18n.default_locale = :lv config.i18n.fallbacks = {:lv => :en}
All the test lines with "assert something.invalid?" fail with error 'I18n::InvalidLocale: nil is not a valid locale'. Trace(below) doesn't show anything useful. Removing fallbacks by commenting the fallback line fixes the issue.

version.body-html:
Adding a locale fallback seems to break unit tests which check validation failures.

Part of app is localised, but the rest, including all the standard validation messages should fall back to english.

With the following code in application.rb
config.i18n.default_locale = :lv
config.i18n.fallbacks = {:lv => :en}

All the test lines with "assert something.invalid?" fail with error 'I18n::InvalidLocale: nil is not a valid locale'.
Trace(below) doesn't show anything useful.
Removing fallbacks by commenting the fallback line fixes the issue.

version.title: config.i18n.fallbacks away from default locale seems to break unit tests

version.body:
I think you want this:
config.i18n.fallbacks.map = { :lv => :en }
Note that you could also do this:
config.i18n.locale = :lv config.i18n.fallbacks = true
That would also result in falling back to en when a translation in lv couldn't be found.
version.body-html:
I think you want this:

config.i18n.fallbacks.map = { :lv => :en }

Note that you could also do this:

config.i18n.locale = :lv config.i18n.fallbacks = true

That would also result in falling back to en when a translation in lv couldn't be found.
version.title: config.i18n.fallbacks away from default locale seems to break unit tests

version.body: PeterisP, the above solution should work. Closing ticket. In case it doesn't resolve the issue please leave a comment as such.
version.body-html: PeterisP, the above solution should work. Closing ticket. In case it doesn't resolve the issue please leave a comment as such.
version.title: config.i18n.fallbacks away from default locale seems to break unit tests

version.body:
Thank you, this did resolve the issue.
The config.i18n.fallbacks = {:lv => :en} was based on the original patch description at https://rails.lighthouseapp.com/projects/8994/tickets/4428-add-a-configi18nfallback-setting-and-enable-fallbacks-in-environmentproductionrb
version.body-html:
Thank you, this did resolve the issue.

The config.i18n.fallbacks = {:lv => :en} was based on the original patch description at https://rails.lighthouseapp.com/projects/8994/tickets/4428-add-a-co...
version.title: config.i18n.fallbacks away from default locale seems to break unit tests
